projects.title: Peachtree Road Race Contest
projects.subtitle: Lead generation contest created for the Peachtree Road Race Expo.
projects.summary:
A lead generation contest created for the Peachtree Road Race Expo where applicants submit contact information and preferences in order to win a drawing for the following year's road race.  The applicant's info was submitted to a database at the time of submission which was only accessible during the open hours of the expo.  One applicant was drawn at random at the top of each open hour of the expo, and applicants were notified immediately depending on their preference (email or text).  The dashboard referenced above was for administrators of the contest to monitor applicants and winners in realtime.

NOTE: The information being utilized on the dashboard is mock data in order to protect applicant's private information.  Form and notification email in attachments.
tech: Amazon Web Services (Elastic Beanstalk, S3, RDS, Route 53)

projects.title: Email Pattern Library
projects.subtitle: Front-end pattern library created for the simple assembly of responsive, company branded emails.
projects.summary: A front-end pattern library created for the simple assembly of responsive, company branded emails.  Emails are assembled by populating a foundational template with modular components in order to be assembled rather than coding each time from scratch.  Assembly system is used to create emails in .msg format which is then attached and sent to employers and/or brokers in order to send from internal ESP's.  Code snippets are pulled from a custom, external API and are hosted in a central repository, which is generated and updated independently from the front-end.
tech: Amazon Web Services (Elastic Beanstalk, S3, RDS, Route 53)

projects.title: Joy-Duino
projects.subtitle: Animated LEDs displaying the word JOY powered by an Arduino Uno.
projects.summary: A personal project in which I assembled LEDs within paper mache letters displaying the word JOY.  The LEDs were powered and animated by an Arduino Uno using the FastLED open source library.

projects.title: Innovation Studio
projects.subtitle: Brand identity and digital marketing material development for Anthem's internal innovation lab.
projects.summary: Through this project, I led a team of art directors and writers and to create the brand identity and microsite concept for Anthem's internal innovation lab.  This project shaped the visual identity of the entire studio, including the environmental design for the studio itself.

projects.title: Anthem In A Box
projects.subtitle: A proof of concept prototype used to illustrate the potential of using augmented reality for the Welcome To Anthem experience.
projects.summary: A quickly assembled proof of concept prototype used to illustrate the potential of using augmented reality for the “Welcome to Anthem” experience.  The idea is to offer an enhanced digital interaction for a new member by offering engaging visuals, communications, and resources through augmented reality in order to explain challenging concepts and direct them to register online.

projects.title: Marcom Sizzle Reel
projects.subtitle: In-house marketing department sizzle reel.
projects.summary: A quickly assembled sizzle reel in order to showcase department accomplishments to executive management for mid year review.

projects.title: Standard Anthem Video Pages
projects.subtitle: Universal landing pages used to display external marketing videos.
projects.summary: Universal landing pages used to display external marketing videos.  Capable of displaying 7 different brands based solely on the bctid parameter in the url.  The page reads the bctid parameter in the url and calls the Brightcove API in order to retrieve the video according to the user's connection and device, and returns metadata about the video to be displayed on the screen (logo, header and legal info).

projects.title: Snack Cycle
projects.subtitle: iPad game used to generate leads for sales conventions.
projects.summary: An iPad game used to generate leads for sales conventions.  Users are required to submit email information in order to participate, and winners with top scores received a prize.  The objective is to jump (tap) and duck (tap + hold) in order to collect healthy food and avoid unhealthy food.  An energy meter is shown, which diminishes over the duration of the game.  In order to keep their energy up throughout the game, the user collects healthy food, which increases the energy meter.  Subsequently, if unhealthy food is gathered, the player's energy depletes faster.  Once the player advances to the next level (3 total), healthy tips periodically display on screen.

projects.title: Member Experience Framework
projects.subtitle: Microsite framework engineered for pre-sale replication and customization.
projects.summary: This microsite framework was engineered for the purpose of replication and customization for use in pre-sale proposals.  The 3 scenarios provided included single, couple, and family personas that have unique assets and resources displayed to the user depending on their choice.  In addition to verbiage and links, various other resources are customizable within the framework depending on the client such as resource links, executive summary and company contacts.  The integration of simple data structures allows ability to generate and update content easily while offering an engaging user experience.

projects.title: M-GO Movies + TV
projects.subtitle: Mobile streaming video service featured on a full spectrum of devices and operating systems.
projects.summary:
M-GO was a joint venture between DreamWorks Animation and Technicolor. It was available on major platforms and functions on a full spectrum of operating systems ranging from Android to iOS to Windows. M-GO is pre-loaded on Samsung’s Smart TV’s, Blu-ray players and Wi-Fi tablets, LG Smart TVs and Blu-ray players, VIZIO’s Smart TVs, Blu-ray players, Wi-Fi tablets and digital media players, and Roku streaming players.

In my role during the incubation period of M-GO as a startup, I primarily developed AS3 software and applications to be featured within the core UI framework for tablets and phones. I continuously worked in conjunction with Product Owners, UX Designers, Front-End and Back-End Developers, and QA in an Agile work environment in order to have direct ownership of the product's evolution. The software I contributed was featured at the Technicolor booth at the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) in Las Vegas in 2010, 2011 and 2012.
